jdd

Class JDDVars

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdd.JDDVars
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<JDDNode>

    public class JDDVars
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<JDDNode>
    Container for MTBDD variables. Each variable is represented by a JDDNode (result of JDD.Var(), a projection function). It is assumed in general that each JDDNode held in a JDDVars container counts as a single reference and that a JDDVars object is cleared using derefAll() when no longer used. This will dereference all the variables contained in the JDDVars object.

      • addVar

        public void addVar(JDDNode var)
        Appends a variable to this JDDVars container.
        [ DEREFs: var (on derefAll call) ]

      • addVars

        @Deprecated
public void addVars(JDDVars ddv)
        Deprecated. 
        Appends the variables of another JDDVars container to this container. Does not increase the refcount of the JDDNodes!
        This method is deprecated, better use copy() or copyVarsFrom() instead. These simplify variable reference count debugging.

      • copy

        public JDDVars copy()
        Creates a copy of this JDDVars container, containing referenced copies of each variable JDDNode in this container.

      • copyVarsFrom

        public void copyVarsFrom(JDDVars ddv)
        Copies variables from another JDDVars container, appending to this container. Does a (referencing) copy of each of the variable JDDNodes.

      • copyArray

        public static JDDVars[] copyArray(JDDVars[] vararray)
        Copy an array of JDDVars[] by copying each JDDVars container. The copy will have fully referenced JDDNodes.

      • mergeVarsFrom

        public void mergeVarsFrom(JDDVars ddv)
        Copy JDDNodes from another JDDVars, merge into the existing variables, sorting by the variable indices. Afterwards, this JDDVars container is fully sorted by variable indices, i.e., the existing variables are sorted as well.
        Parameters:
        ddv - the new variables

      • removeVar

        public void removeVar(JDDNode v)
        Remove variable v from container. Does not decrease the refcount.

      • removeVars

        public void removeVars(JDDVars ddv)
        Removes the JDDNodes contained in ddv from this JDDVars container. Does not decrease the refcount!

      • getNumVars

        public int getNumVars()
        Returns the number of variables stored in this JDDVars container.

        @Deprecated
public void refAll()
        Deprecated. 
        Increases the refcount of all contained JDDNodes.
        This method is deprecated, please use copy() and copyVarsFrom() instead. This simplifies reference counting debugging.
